database.name: Pannkoogid
database.author: Margit
database.description: This is our family classic for Sunday mornings. Sunday without pancakes is just a day. Here is my base recipe, nowadays I add and modify it with ingredients I find at home
database.instruction: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk and egg. Add dry ingredients to milk mixture; whisk until all is neat.

database.name: Estonian Potato Salad
database.author: Margit
database.description: This salad is loved by Estonians from all walks of life. It’s a true Estonian staple, and one of the country’s most popular foods.
database.instruction:
Boil the potatoes in salted water the day before. Let it cool completely - potatoes cooked in a hurry on the same day do not become a real salad!

To make a salad, peel boiled potatoes and chop into small cubes. Cut the boiled cooled eggs into small cubes or crush them with a fork. Chop the cucumber into small cubes. Chop the onion or leek very finely (if desired, soak the chopped onion in a little cold water, it will soften the taste). Chop the sausage into small cubes.

The sauce should be mixed in a separate bowl. Mix sour cream, mayonnaise and mustard. Add chopped dill, onion tops, salt and pepper (the more summertime, the more I add herbs). Pour the sauce over the salad ingredients and mix gently.

Before serving, let the salad season in the pantry for about 2-4 hours.

database.name: Cuba Libre
database.author: unknown
database.description: A traditional way to mix rum an coke.
database.instruction:
1-Fill a highball glass with ice, then add rum and Coca-Cola.

Garnish with a lime wedge. 2-Squeeze the lime into your drink, if desired.

database.name: Mojito
database.author: unknown
database.description: This Cuban cocktail is a blend of a few simple ingredients, but the resulting drink is the perfect balance of sweet and tart, not to mention refreshing!
database.instruction:
Step 1
Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler and crush to release mint oils and lime juice.

Step 2
Add remaining lime wedges and 2 tablespoons sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice. Do not strain the mixture.

Step 3
Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour in rum and fill the glass with club soda.

Step 4
Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired.
